caption:
This photograph appears to depict an aerial or satellite view of a landscape, primarily characterized by a broad expanse of rugged terrain with shades of pink and brownish tones, suggesting desert-like features or arid land. The area is textured with natural patterns, which include undulating ridges and depressions. The landscape exhibits varied levels of brightness and color saturation, adding visual interest and depth to the image.

Scattered throughout this terrain are numerous bright spotsâ€”likely representing the lights of human settlements or illuminated areas. These lights glow against the darker shades of the natural landscape, emphasizing human presence and activity within this otherwise desolate region. The distribution of lights appears somewhat concentrated in specific areas, implying the possible locations of towns or cities.

The upper right part of the image has what looks like a denser cluster of lights, indicating a potentially more heavily populated or urbanized area. The lighting and the distribution of illuminated areas could also suggest some form of connectivity, possibly roads or paths linking these zones.

No sky, people, or moving objects are visible in the image. The overall impression is one of observing a remote and sparsely inhabited region from a considerable altitude, providing a unique perspective that highlights both geological features and human habitation.
title: Outfall from the Tallman Island sewage treatment plant into the East River in the metropolitan New York area. Rivers which flow through the region carry raw and partially digested sewage and chemical and industrial wastes into the waters of the bight accumulation of wastes in waters bordering the bight present one of the most critical stresses to its environment.
